original: grahāṇām atha ṛkṣāṇāṃ rudrāṇāṃ vasubhiḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: grahāṇām atha ṛkṣāṇām rudrāṇām vasubhiḥ saha
translated: Of the planets, the constellations, the Rudras together with the Vasus,

original: ādityānāṃ samarutāṃ bhṛgūṇāṃ ca tathā dvija /
analyzed: ādityānām sa marutām bhṛgūṇām ca tathā dvija
translated: Of the Adityas, the Maruts, and the Bhrigus, O Brahmin,

analyzed: tathā eva aṅgirasaḥ rājan sādhyānām aśvibhiḥ saha
translated: And likewise of the Angirasas, O king, together with the Sadhyas and the Ashvins,

analyzed: daityānām atha nāgānām gandharva uraga rakṣasām
translated: Of the Daityas, the Nagas, the Gandharvas, the Uragas, and the Rakshasas,

analyzed: pitṛ pannaga yakṣāṇām tathā ca piśitāśinām  manuṣya haya nāgānām gaja aśva mṛga pakṣiṇām
translated: Of the ancestors, the serpents, the Yakshas, and likewise the flesh-eaters,🔽Of humans, horses, elephants, and also of elephants, horses, deer, and birds,

analyzed: dvīpi śārdūla siṃhānām sarveṣām prāṇinām atha
translated: Of islands, tigers, and lions, and of all living beings,

original: kānicit tasya saumyāni kānicid bhīṣaṇāni ca /
analyzed: kānicid tasya saumyāni kānicid bhīṣaṇāni ca
translated: Some of them are gentle, some are terrifying,

analyzed: dadarśa tasya vaktrāṇi sahasraśas
translated: He saw hundreds and thousands of faces of that (form).

analyzed: vaktreṣu tasya raudrasya prāṇi saṃghāni anekaśas
translated: In the terrible faces of that (form), he saw multitudes of creatures in many ways.

original: dadarśa sarvataś cāgnīn grasyamānāṃś ca viṣṇunā // / / //
analyzed: dadarśa sarvatas ca agnīn grasyamānān ca viṣṇunā
translated: And he saw fires being swallowed by Vishnu everywhere.

original: saumyebhyas tasya vaktrebhyo nirgacchantyas tathā prajāḥ /
analyzed: saumyebhyaḥ tasya vaktrebhyaḥ nirgacchantyaḥ tathā prajāḥ
translated: And the people were coming out from the gentle faces of that (form).

original: vāhāṃś ca vividhāṃs tasya sa dadarśātha nāradaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vāhān ca vividhān tasya sa dadarśa atha nāradaḥ
translated: And Narada then saw the various vehicles of that (form).

analyzed: hastān ca vividha ākārān nānā mudrā samanvitān
translated: And the hands of various forms, endowed with various gestures,

original: yuktān nānāvidhair bhāṇḍair āyudhaiś ca sahasraśaḥ // / / //🔽sruksruvāvedicamasa kuśakṛṣṇājināgnibhiḥ /🔽kecic ca kalaśaṃ ghaṇṭāṃ śaṅkhapadmotpalādibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yuktān nānāvidhaiḥ bhāṇḍaiḥ āyudhaiḥ ca sahasraśas  sruc sruva ā vedi camasa kuśa kṛṣṇājina agnibhiḥ  kecid ca kalaśam ghaṇṭām śaṅkha padma utpala ādibhiḥ
translated: Equipped with various kinds of vessels and weapons in thousands.🔽With sacrificial ladles, sacrificial spoons, altars, bowls, kusha grass, black antelope skins, and fires,

analyzed: kecid khaḍga gadā cakra carma śūla paraśvadhaiḥ
translated: Some with water pots, bells, conches, lotuses, blue lotuses, and so on,

analyzed: kecid pāśa mahā daṇḍa kṛpāṇa śara kārmukaiḥ
translated: Some with swords, clubs, discuses, shields, spears, and axes,🔽Some with nooses, large staffs, scimitars, arrows, and bows,

analyzed: kecid bhuśuṇḍī laguḍa śakti vajra aśma paṭṭiśaiḥ
translated: Some with bhushundi, clubs, javelins, diamonds, and axes,

analyzed: bīja pūrṇa akṣamālāḥ ca pūrṇa pātraiḥ tathā paraiḥ
translated: With rosaries full of seeds, and with other full vessels,

original: evaṃ nānāvidhair bhāṇḍaiḥ karāṃs tasya samanvitān /
analyzed: evam nānāvidhaiḥ bhāṇḍaiḥ karān tasya samanvitān
translated: In this way, the best of sages saw innumerable taxes collected from various kinds of vessels.

original: asaṃkhyeyān mahātejā dadarśa munisattamaḥ // / / //🔽nṛttaśāstravinirdiṣṭo nṛttakarmaṇi cāpy atha /🔽śirāṃsi dṛṣṭayo hastāṃs tasya devasya dṛṣṭavān // / / //🔽trailokyaṃ ca T kāye sakalaṃ munisattamaḥ /
analyzed: asaṃkhyeyān mahā tejāḥ dadarśa muni sattamaḥ  nṛtta śāstra vinirdiṣṭaḥ nṛtta karmaṇi ca api atha  śirāṃsi dṛṣṭayaḥ hastān tasya devasya dṛṣṭavān  trailokyam ca kāye sakalam muni sattamaḥ
translated: The greatly energetic one saw them all.🔽He saw the head, eyes and hands of the god, as described in the science of dance, engaged in the act of dance.

original: devadānavagandharva sayakṣoragarakṣasām // / / //🔽dvīpāmbhonidhilokaiś ca pātālaiś caiva saṃyutam /
analyzed: deva dānava gandharva sa yakṣa uraga rakṣasām  dvīpa ambhonidhi lokaiḥ ca pātālaiḥ ca eva saṃyutam
translated: The best of sages saw the entire three worlds in the body of the god, along with the gods, demons, gandharvas, yakshas, serpents and rakshasas.

original: jagat samagraṃ devasya dehasthaṃ dṛṣṭavān muniḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagat samagram devasya deha stham dṛṣṭavān muniḥ
translated: The sage saw the entire universe, along with the continents, oceans, worlds and nether regions, residing in the body of the god.

original: sa dṛṣṭvā paramaṃ rūpaṃ bhīto hṛṣṭaś ca vismitaḥ /
analyzed: sa dṛṣṭvā paramam rūpam bhītaḥ hṛṣṭaḥ ca vismitaḥ
translated: Having seen that supreme form, he was frightened, delighted and amazed.

analyzed: papāta pādayoḥ tasya śirasā sa aśru locanaḥ
translated: With tears in his eyes, he fell at his feet with his head.

analyzed: stotreṇa ca eva tuṣṭāva pūrva uktena janārdanam
translated: And he praised Janardana with the previously mentioned hymn.

original: tam uvāca tato devaḥ prahasann ṛṣisattamam // / / //
analyzed: tam uvāca tatas devaḥ prahasan ṛṣi sattamam
translated: Then the god, smiling, spoke to the best of sages:

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: uttiṣṭha mā bhair dharmajña varaṃ vṛṇu yathepsitam /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha mā bhaiḥ dharma jña varam vṛṇu yathā īpsitam
translated: Rise up, O knower of Dharma, do not be afraid. Choose a boon as you desire.

analyzed: uvāca
translated: Shree Narada said:

original: nityam ekāntike deva bhaktir bhavatu sā tvayi /
analyzed: nityam ekāntike deva bhaktiḥ bhavatu sā tvayi
translated: May my devotion to you, O God, be constant and exclusive.

original: nānyaṃ varaṃ kāmayāmi narāṇām idam uttamam // / / //
analyzed: na anyam varam kāmayāmi narāṇām idam uttamam
translated: I do not desire any other boon, this is the best for men.

analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: tam uvāca tato devaḥ praṇatārtiharo hariḥ /
analyzed: tam uvāca tatas devaḥ praṇata ārti haraḥ hariḥ
translated: Then the god Hari, the remover of the distress of those who bow down, said to him:

original: etan nisargasiddhaṃ te yena tvaṃ dṛṣṭavān mama // / / //
analyzed: etat nisarga siddham te yena tvam dṛṣṭavān mama
translated: This is naturally accomplished by you, by which you have seen my form.

original: viśvarūpam idaṃ brahmann avajñeyaṃ tathā tvayā /
analyzed: viśva rūpam idam brahman avajñeyam tathā tvayā
translated: This universal form, O Brahmin, should be disregarded by you in the same way.

original: tapas taptaṃ yato vipra mamāpi ca tatas tava // / / //
analyzed: tapaḥ taptam yatas vipra mama api ca tatas tava
translated: Since austerity has been performed by you, O Brahmin, therefore it is mine and yours.

original: rūpam etat samāsthāya rūpaṃ svaṃ dvija darśitam /
analyzed: rūpam etat samāsthāya rūpam svam dvija darśitam
translated: Having assumed this form, O Brahmin, my own form has been shown to you.

analyzed: icchā rūpāṇi aham kuryām sahasraśas
translated: I can create hundreds and thousands of forms at will.

analyzed: trailokye yāni rūpāṇi deva ādīnām dvijottama
translated: Whatever forms there are in the three worlds of the gods and others, O best of Brahmins,

original: mamaiva tāni jānīha matto 'nyan nāsti kiṃcana // / / //🔽ahaṃ bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca vartamānam ahaṃ tathā /
analyzed: mama eva tāni jāni iha mattaḥ na asti kiṃcana  aham bhūtam ca bhavyam ca vartamānam aham tathā
translated: Know them to be mine alone. There is nothing else but me.

original: sthāvaraṃ jaṅgamaṃ caiva sarvam evāsmi nārada // / / //
analyzed: sthāvaram jaṅgamam ca eva sarvam eva asmi nārada
translated: I am the past, the future, and the present, and also the moving and unmoving. I am everything, O Narada.

original: sac cāsac cāham evātra tattvam etad bravīmi te /
analyzed: sat ca asat ca aham eva atra tattvam etat bravīmi te
translated: The existent and the non-existent are indeed me. This is the truth I tell you.

analyzed: a śabdam a rasam sparśa gandha rūpa vivarjitam
translated: Soundless, tasteless, devoid of touch, smell and form.

analyzed: sarvagam mām vijānīhi parama arthena nārada
translated: Know me to be all-pervading in the ultimate sense, Narada.

original: yaḥ kariṣyati me stotraṃ stotreṇa tvatkṛtena tu // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ kariṣyati me stotram stotreṇa tvad kṛtena tu
translated: He who will perform my praise with the praise composed by you,

original: tasya kāmān vidhāsyāmi ye divyā ye ca mānuṣāḥ /
analyzed: tasya kāmān vidhāsyāmi ye divyāḥ ye ca mānuṣāḥ
translated: I will grant him desires, both divine and human.

original: śvetadvīpe gatis tasya mṛtasya ca bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: śvetadvīpe gatiḥ tasya mṛtasya ca bhaviṣyati
translated: For him who dies, there will be a destination in Shvetadvipa.

original: śvetadvīpam avāpyāpi naraḥ svastho bhaviṣyasi /🔽varāhasyāsya kalpasya yāvat kālo 'vaśiṣyate // / / //
analyzed: śvetadvīpam avāpya api naraḥ svasthaḥ bhaviṣyasi  varāhasya asya kalpasya yāvat kālaḥ
translated: Having attained Shvetadvipa, the man will be at ease.🔽For as long as the time remains for this Kalpa of the Boar,

original: vārāhe tu gate kalpe tato mātsyo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vārāhe tu gate kalpe tatas mātsyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When the Kalpa of the Boar is over, then the Fish will appear.

analyzed: deva kāryāṇi kāryāṇi su bahūni yatas tvayā
translated: Since you have to perform many tasks for the gods,

analyzed: prādurbhāva gataḥ ca aham anuśāsyaḥ tathā tvayā
translated: And I have manifested, you should instruct me thus.

analyzed: prādurbhāvāṇi me brahman vyatītāni sahasraśas
translated: O Brahma, thousands of my manifestations have passed,

original: bhaviṣyanti tathānyāni tatra me śṛṇu kānicit /🔽aham ekārṇave loke śeṣaparyaṅkaśāyikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyanti tathā anyāni tatra me śṛṇu kānicid  aham ekārṇave loke śeṣa paryaṅka śāyikaḥ
translated: And there will be others in the future. Listen to some of them.🔽When the grandfather is asleep, I remain in the one ocean of the world, lying on the couch of the serpent Shesha,

analyzed: lakṣmī sahāyaḥ tiṣṭhāmi yadā suptaḥ pitāmahaḥ
translated: With Lakshmi as my companion.

original: ahaṃ matsyas tathā kūrmo haṃso 'ham api nārada // / / //🔽strīrūpeṇa mayā vipra vañcitā daityadānavāḥ /
analyzed: aham matsyaḥ tathā kūrmaḥ haṃsaḥ ham api nārada  strī rūpeṇa mayā vipra vañcitāḥ daitya dānavāḥ
translated: I am the fish, the tortoise, and the swan, O Narada.🔽O Brahmin, in the form of a woman, I have deceived the demons and Danavas.

analyzed: mayā aśvaśirasā vedāḥ dānavebhyaḥ tathā hṛtāḥ
translated: By me, in the form of a horse-headed one, the Vedas were taken away from the demons.

analyzed: vārāheṇa mayā bhūtvā vasudhā iyam samuddhṛtā
translated: By becoming the boar, I have lifted up this earth.

original: vārāheṇa mayā daityāḥ pātālatalagā hatāḥ // / / //🔽nṛvarāheṇa nihato hiraṇyākṣo balotkaṭaḥ /
analyzed: vārāheṇa mayā daityāḥ pātāla tala gāḥ hatāḥ  nṛvarāheṇa nihataḥ hiraṇyākṣaḥ bala utkaṭaḥ
translated: By the boar form of mine, the demons dwelling in the nether regions have been killed.🔽By the human boar, the powerful Hiranyaksha has been killed.

analyzed: dānavāḥ ca hatāḥ yuddhe nara nārāyaṇa ātmanā
translated: And the demons have been killed in the battle by the form of Nara-Narayana.

original: lokottare tathā mārge hariḥ kṛṣṇas tathāpy aham /
analyzed: lokottare tathā mārge hariḥ kṛṣṇaḥ tathā api aham
translated: And in the extraordinary path, I am Hari Krishna.

analyzed: nārasiṃhena rūpeṇa hiraṇyakaśipuḥ hataḥ
translated: By the Narasimha form, Hiranyakashipu has been killed.

original: vāmanena mayā bhūtvā bales tribhuvanaṃ hṛtam /
analyzed: vāmanena mayā bhūtvā baleḥ tribhuvanam hṛtam
translated: By becoming the dwarf, the three worlds of Bali have been taken away by me.

original: tribhiḥ kramaiḥ purā brahman devānāṃ hitakāmyayā // / / //
analyzed: tribhiḥ kramaiḥ purā brahman devānām hita kāmyayā
translated: In ancient times, O Brahmin, by three steps, for the welfare of the gods.

analyzed: vāḍavaḥ ham samudra sthaḥ pibāmi salilam sadā
translated: I am the submarine fire, always drinking the water in the ocean.

original: pṛthvī vasumatī brahman pṛthunā ca mayā kṛtā // / / //
analyzed: pṛthvī vasumatī brahman pṛthunā ca mayā kṛtā
translated: O Brahmin, the earth, the sustainer of wealth, has been made by me, Prithu.

analyzed: kapilena mayā duṣṭāḥ dagdhavyāḥ sagara ātmajāḥ
translated: By Kapila, the wicked sons of Sagara are to be burnt by me.

analyzed: dattātreyeṇa vasudhā devāḥ dvija gaṇāḥ punar
translated: O Brahmin! The earth was given by Dattatreya to the gods and the Ganas.

analyzed: jāmadagnyena rāmeṇa laghvī vasumatī kṛtā
translated: The earth was made light by Rama, the son of Jamadagni.

analyzed: tris sapta kṛtvas kartavyā kṣatra bhāra prapīḍitā
translated: It should be done twenty-one times, oppressed by the burden of Kshatriyas.

original: dattvā caturdhā putrāṃś ca mayā daśarathasya ca /
analyzed: dattvā caturdhā putrān ca mayā daśarathasya ca
translated: Having given my sons and Dasharatha's sons,

analyzed: rāmeṇa rāvaṇa vadhaḥ kartavyaḥ janatā sukham
translated: Rama should perform the killing of Ravana for the happiness of the people.

analyzed: kāryam gandharvanidhanam tathā eva bharata ātmanā
translated: The killing of the Gandharvas should be done by Bharata's son,

analyzed: meghanāda vadhaḥ kāryaḥ lakṣmaṇena tathā mayā
translated: and the killing of Meghanada should be done by Lakshmana and myself.

original: śatrughnena ca kartavyo lavaṇasya vadhas tathā /
analyzed: śatrughnena ca kartavyaḥ lavaṇasya vadhaḥ tathā
translated: And the killing of Lavana should be done by Shatrughna,

original: mayā vālmīkinā kāryaṃ kāvyaṃ rāmāyaṇaṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: mayā vālmīkinā kāryam kāvyam rāmāyaṇam tathā
translated: and by me, Valmiki, the Ramayana poem should be composed.

original: vyāsena vedā vaktavyā ākhyānaṃ bhārataṃ mahat /
analyzed: vyāsena vedāḥ vaktavyāḥ ākhyānam bhāratam mahat
translated: The Vedas should be spoken by Vyasa, and the great story of the Mahabharata,

analyzed: mayā brāhmaṇa śārdūla tathā dvaipāyana ātmanā
translated: and by me, the tiger among Brahmins, in the form of Dvaipayana.

original: pāṇḍoḥ putratvam āsādya pañcadhā ca tathā mayā /
analyzed: pāṇḍoḥ putra tvam āsādya pañcadhā ca tathā mayā
translated: Having attained the status of Pandu's son, and in five ways by me,

original: dvidhā ca vasudevasya laghvī kāryā vasuṃdharā // / / //
analyzed: dvidhā ca vasudevasya laghvī kāryā vasuṃdharā
translated: and in two ways by Vasudeva, the earth should be made light.

analyzed: nara loke nihantavyāḥ daityāḥ mānuṣa rūpiṇaḥ
translated: The demons in human form should be killed in the world of men.

analyzed: balabhadreṇa ca mayā hantavyāḥ mauṣṭika ādayaḥ
translated: And by me, Balabhadra, the gamblers and others should be killed.

analyzed: mayā kṛṣṇena hantavyāḥ kaṃsa pūrvāḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: By me, Krishna, the greatly powerful ones beginning with Kamsa should be killed.

analyzed: pradyumnena nihantavyaḥ śambaraḥ ca mahā balaḥ
translated: By Pradyumna, the greatly powerful Shambara should be killed.

analyzed: hantavyāḥ ca aniruddhena daityāḥ śata sahasraśas
translated: By Aniruddha, the demons should be killed in hundreds and thousands.

original: sāmbena yuyudhānena mayā bhūtvā tathaiva ca // / / //
analyzed: sāmbena yuyudhānena mayā bhūtvā tathā eva ca
translated: By Samva, Yuyudhana, and by me, having become so,

original: mayā buddhena vaktavyā dharmāḥ kaliyuge punaḥ /
analyzed: mayā buddhena vaktavyāḥ dharmāḥ kali yuge punar
translated: By me, the Buddha, the duties should be again spoken in the Kali age.

analyzed: hantavyāḥ mleccha rājānaḥ tathā viṣṇu vaśa ātmanā
translated: And the barbarian kings should be killed by me, having become Vishnu's self.

analyzed: mama aṃśena vijānīhi pṛthivyām cakravartinaḥ
translated: Know that the emperors on earth are born from a part of me.

analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ca tathā jñeyāḥ mama eva aṃśa samudbhavāḥ
translated: And the sages should also be known as born from a part of me.

original: yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṃ śrīmadūrjitam eva ca /
analyzed: yat yat vibhūtimat sattvam śrīmat ūrjitam eva ca
translated: Whatever being is endowed with glory, prosperity, and strength,

original: tat tad evāvagacches tvaṃ mama tejo'ṃśasaṃbhavam // / / //
analyzed: tat tat eva avagaccheḥ tvam mama tejaḥ ṃśa saṃbhavam
translated: Know that it is born from a part of my energy.

original: atha vā bahunaitena kiṃ jñānena tavānagha /
analyzed: atha vā bahunā etena kim jñānena tava anagha
translated: Or what is the use of this much knowledge to you, O sinless one?

analyzed: viṣṭabhya aham idam kṛtsnam eka aṃśena āsthitaḥ jagat
translated: I, having pervaded this entire world, stand with one part.

original: tad gaccha mānasī siddhiḥ sadā te 'stu dvijottama /
analyzed: tat gaccha mānasī siddhiḥ sadā te stu dvijottama
translated: Therefore, go. May you always attain mental perfection, O best of Brahmins.

analyzed: kalpa avasānam āsādya mad śarīram pravekṣyasi
translated: and at the end of the aeon, you will enter my body.

analyzed: etāvat uktvā vacanam tatra eva antaradhīyata
translated: Having spoken these words, he disappeared right there.

analyzed: bhagavān nāradaḥ cakre pujām tad deśa vāsinām
translated: And Lord Narada worshipped the residents of that region.

original: taiś ca saṃpūjito vipras tān praṇamya yatavrataḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ ca saṃpūjitaḥ vipraḥ tān praṇamya yata vrataḥ
translated: And the brahmin, worshipped by them, bowed to them, and of firm vows,

analyzed: ājagāma tatas śīghram nara nārāyaṇa āśramam
translated: then quickly went to the hermitage of Nara and Narayana.

original: pādayor nyapatat tatra sa tayor munipūjyayoḥ /
analyzed: pādayoḥ nyapatat tatra sa tayoḥ muni pūjyayoḥ
translated: He fell at the feet of those two venerable sages,

analyzed: tābhyām saṃpūjitaḥ vipraḥ tatra uvāsa tad āśrame
translated: and the brahmin, worshipped by them, then stayed in that hermitage.

original: tataḥ kadācit taṃ vipram ūcatus tau tapodhanau /
analyzed: tatas kadācid tam vipram ūcatuḥ tau tapodhanau
translated: Then one day, those two ascetics said to that brahmin:

analyzed: āvābhyām tvam tathā dṛṣṭaḥ śvetadvīpa gate cyutaḥ
translated: We have seen you as Achyuta, gone to Shvetadvipa,

analyzed: samīpam devadevasya tad deha sthaiḥ yathāsukham
translated: happily residing in that body of the Lord of gods,

analyzed: loke smin muni śārdūla nā asti dhanyataraḥ tvayā
translated: in this world, O tiger among sages, there is none more blessed than you,

original: dṛṣṭavān asi yad brahman viśvarūpadharaṃ harim /
analyzed: dṛṣṭavān asi yat brahman viśva rūpa dharam harim
translated: since you have seen Hari, O brahmin, who assumes the form of the universe,
